gr.auth.csd.taskmanager

Class DBHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • gr.auth.csd.taskmanager.DBHandler

  • public class DBHandler
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
    The main DB class needed for the application. It extends SQLiteOpenHelper class, and holds our database schema, as well as provides methods for database manipulation (add, update, delete, etc.) Created by Steve Laskaridis on 1/5/2015.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db)
        Called when the database is created for the first time. This is where the creation of tables and the initial population of the tables should happen.
        Parameters:
        db - The database.

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db,
                      int oldVersion,
                      int newVersion)
        Called when the database needs to be upgraded. The implementation should use this method to drop tables, add tables, or do anything else it needs to upgrade to the new schema version.

        The SQLite ALTER TABLE documentation can be found here. If you add new columns you can use ALTER TABLE to insert them into a live table. If you rename or remove columns you can use ALTER TABLE to rename the old table, then create the new table and then populate the new table with the contents of the old table.

        This method executes within a transaction. If an exception is thrown, all changes will automatically be rolled back.

        Parameters:
        db - The database.
        oldVersion - The old database version.
        newVersion - The new database version.

        public void addRecord(MemoryInfo obj)

      • getRecord

        public MemoryInfo getRecord(java.util.Date date)
                     throws java.text.ParseException
        Function that returns an instance of the MemoryInfo class, holding the information of a record of a particular date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date of the record that we would like to retrieve
        Returns:
        a MemoryInfo instance
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - in case the method parseLong() of Long class fails.

      • getAllRecords

        public java.util.List<MemoryInfo> getAllRecords()
                                         throws java.text.ParseException
        Function that returns a List of MemoryInfo objects, holding all available records. Used in the ListView of all saved records.
        Returns:
        the List that are hold by our database
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - in case the method parseLong() of Long class fails.
